Name: Think Tank
Description:
Yet another packaging of Guggenheim/Categories.

A spinner determines what five categories and the five initial letters will use. The players have three minutes to complete their grids. When time has elapsed, each player may choose any square on one's grid for a free ten points. Players, then, compare answers. Ten points are scored for each unique answer. Each player scores five points for each duplicated answer. There is no penalty for illegal or no responses.

The player with the most points is the winner.

One interesting note: the game's catalog number is 666.

Name: Masters of Venice: Mini-Expansion Set
Description:
5 additional characters to expand the mix in the game in all new directions!

In both English and German language

New characters include:
The Carpenter - Someone to take care of all that excess lumber you lug around...
The Money Lender - A little extra bump for those volatile stock markets...
The Porter - Too much to sell? Not a problem...
The Docks Master - Well, well, look at what fell off that last shipment...
The Minstrel - the musical key to marketing those hard to sell items...

(Also includes the revised tax collector card!)

Name: Chez Goth: Promokarte Necronomicon
Description:
Chez Goth - Necronomicon is the Promocard number 04 from Pegaus Spiele. It is a slack 3, cost 3 card - class thing (book)

"Es zu lesen, ist relativ ungefährlich, man darf nur auf keinen Fall daraus zitieren..."

translates as:

"To read it is not dangerous, one should under no circumstance quote it though"

Name: Kingsburg: Wheel and Deal
Description:
From Fantasy Flight's Website :

"The people of the Realm are variegated: there are lazy nobles and skilled craftsmen, fiery soldiers and humble peasants.  A wise governor knows which group to favour at the right time to get as many benefits as possible for his own career."

This official scenario for "Kingsburg" allows the players to choose archetype roles each years to specialize their talents.

Name: Kingsburg: Goblin Valley
Description:
From Fantasy Flight's Website :

"On the northern edge of the Realm lies a valley inhabited by several belligerent goblin tribes.  While they spend most of their time fighting against each other, they are also always ready to assault any settlers trying to establish a foothold in this land."

This official scenario for "Kingsburg" creates a second deck of Invaders called the Valley Deck.  During each winter, if the top card of the Valley Deck turns out to be a Goblin card, it makes the Invader attack that much more powerful, and hurt even more.

Name: Kingsburg: Shifting Alliances
Description:
From Fantasy Flight's Website :

"The royal Advisors are constantly meddling with each other, creating fragile alliances that rise or crumble as situations evolve or their needs change.  Choosing who to trust and who cannot be ignored is a vital skill for a successful governor."

This official scenario for "Kingsburg" creates a system of changing and mitigating alliances with the various Advisors in the game. Players score victory points when other players influence an Advisor that you are allied with.

Name: Kingsburg: The Demanding Capital
Description:
From Fantasy Flight's Website :

"The Realm is growing and so is the capital city!  While the governors of the peripheral fiefs may not see it often, the King expects regular tributes to contribute to its expansion... or he could forget to send his soldiers to protect the borders"

This official scenario for "Kingsburg" implores a system for contribution to the King, as well as positive and negative outcomes depending on if you make the tithes or not. It requires the use of counters of your choice to be used as "Growth Counters" (e.g. pennies, cubes, etc...)

Name: Arkham Horror: The Dark Pharaoh (Herald)
Description:
From Fantasy Flight's website :

"Know, O Thief, that these things are mine.  For I am the Dark Pharaoh, him of the Crawling Chaos.  Take what is mine and your blood will boil in your skin.  As I reveal to you my Other Faces and my True Glory."

This is an official Herald, published by Fantasy Flight Games (originally only on the website, later also in Arkham Horror: The Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion (Revised Edition)), to be used when using the Herald / Guardian mechanic in games of "Arkham Horror".

Rules Summary :

When the Dark Pharaoh is the Herald, place the Dark Pharaoh monster token in the monster cup at the start of the game even if Nyarlathotep is not the Ancient One.

Know O'Thief : Each time an investigator gains a Unique item (including starting equipment) that investigator loses 1 sanity.

These Things are Mine : Each time an investigator gains an Exhibit item, roll a die. On a failure that investigator is Cursed.

Blood Will Boil : At the start of the Upkeep phase, before rolling for Curses, each Cursed investigator loses 1 stamina.

My Other Faces : All Mask monsters gain 1 toughness. In addition, each time a Mask monster is defeated, add one Doom token to the Ancient One's Doom track.

My True Glory : If Nyarlathotep is the Ancient One and he awakens, his combat modifier increases by 1 (to -5, -6, etc) and he has one extra doom token placed on his doom track (for a total of 12, 13, etc) for each Mask monster on the board.
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Arkham Horror: The Dunwich Horror (Herald)
Description:
From Fantasy Flight's Website :

Let me tell ye suthin - Some day yew folks'll hear a child o' Lavinny's a-callin' its father's name on the top o' Sentinel Hill! - Wizard Whateley

This is an official Herald, published by Fantasy Flight Games (originally only on the website, later also in the Arkham Horror: Miskatonic Horror Expansion), to be used when using the Herald / Guardian mechanic in games of "Arkham Horror".

Rules Summary :

When the Dunwich Horror is the Herald, place one Dunwich Horror token on the Dunwich Horror track at the start of the game. You must use the Dunwich board to use this Herald.

Unnatural Growth : The Dunwich Horror track starts out with one token on it at the start of the game and one additional token is placed on it when the terror level reaches, 3, 6, and 9. This is in addition to the normal conditions under which tokens are added to it.

Yog-Sothoth's Child : The Dunwich Horror is considered to have a circle dimensional symbol as well as a moon dimensional symbol, but only for purposes of movement. It cannot be banished or pulled through a gate because of this symbol.

Father's Name : When the Dunwich Horror moves, it adds a doom token to the Ancient One's doom track on a 3-6 instead of a 4-6.

Father and Son : If Yog-Sothoth is the Ancient One, and he awakens while the Dunwich Horror is on the board, Yog-Sothoth's combat modifier increases by 3 (to -8) and he has five extra doom tokens placed on his doom track (for a total of 17).
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Arkham Horror: Penny Arcade Characters
Description:
From Penny Arcade comes the fabled Investigator Johnathan "Gabe" Gabriel, Investigator Tycho Erasmus Brahe, and Guardian Anne-Claire. These are official expansions from Fantasy Flight Games to be used with games of "Arkham Horror".

Investigator Johnathan "Gabe" Gabriel

Rules Summary :

Home -- River Docks
4 Sanity
6 Stamina 
2 Focus

Fixed Possessions : $6
Random Possessions : 2 Common Items, 1 Unique Item, 1 Skill

Fists of Fury : Any Phase -- Gabe gains a +2 bonus to Combat Checks.

Fists of Rage : If the Doom Track is within 3 spaces of awakening the Ancient One, Gabe automatically passes all Will checks.

Never Again : Tycho no longer allows Gabe to use any Weapons.

Speed -- 1   2   3   4
Sneak -- 4   3   2   1
Fight -- 4   5   6   7
Will  -- 4   3   2   1
Lore  -- 0   1   2   3
Luck  -- 3   2   1   0

Investigator Tycho Erasmus Brahe

Rules Summary :

Home -- The Library
6 Sanity
4 Stamina
2 Focus

Fixed Possessions : $5, 1 Common Item (Tommy Gun), 1 Unique Item (The King in Yellow)
Random Possessions : 2 Unique Items, 1 Skill

Multi-Tasker : Any Phase -- Tycho reduces all movement costs on Tomes to 0.

Rational Man : Any Phase -- Tycho may spend 1 Clue token instead of losing 1 Sanity or 1 Stamina. He may do this as often as he likes but may not use this ability during the Final Battle.

Speed -- 1 2 3 4
Sneak -- 4 3 2 1
Fight -- 0 1 2 3
Will -- 5 4 3 2
Lore -- 2 3 4 5
Luck -- 3 2 1 0

Guardian Anne-Claire

Mechanical Genius : Investigators may always use the location ability of the Administration Building, regardless of other effects.

Cruel Taskmistress : Investigators receive a $1 discount when using the Administration Building's location ability for each Weapon or monster trophy they discard.

To the Rescue : Once per game, after an investigator has made a Combat check, the players may choose to have Anne-Claire show up to help out with her flamethrower. She adds 3 successes to the result of the Combat check.
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Byg
Description:
A 2 player abstract game, played with white and black stones on a Hexhex board. The goal is to have the largest group on the board when the game ends and the board is full.  There is a trick, though: You can place as many stones per turn as you have groups on the board (up to a limit).  There's a tricky balance: you need to connect your groups together to advance toward the goal, but you can't connect them too much or else you won't be able to place as many stones as your opponent.

The current rules:

1. The board begins empty.

2. To begin, White puts a single stone on any vacant space, and then Black does the same.

3. From then on, starting with Black, the players take turns. On your turn you may place as many stones as you have groups on the board, and you may place them onto any vacant spaces.  Except:

*You must place at least one stone.
    *The stones you place may not be adjacent to one another. 
    *If you have more than 3 groups on the board, the maximum number of stones you may place is 3.
    *You may not grow any group by more than one stone.
    *A stone connecting two or three different groups together is considered to have grown them all (at the end of your turn, no group may have more than one new stone in it).

4. The game ends when the board is full and the player with the largest group wins.   If the players’ largest groups are the same size, compare their second-largest groups, and so on, until you come to a pair which aren't the same size.  Whoever owns the larger group wins.

Name: Santa Claus vs. The Easter Bunny
Description:
A tactical game for 2 players.

So Santa and the Easter Bunny were sitting down in a cafe, drinking lattes, and Santa casually mentions that Christmas is more exciting that Easter. To which the Easter Bunny says that Easter brings more joy and happiness than Christmas. Santa, slightly miffed, says "Oh, I doubt that!". The Easter Bunny suggests "Perhaps a friendly contest is in order then. Let's see who can bring the most happiness, joy, and excitement to the children this year!". Santa chugs his latte and says to the Easter Bunny: "Bring it!!!" And the game was on!

This game is a print and play game for two players. It was designed to be relatively quick (29 turns; all quick) and be easy on the print cartridge. It also has basic strategy that may not be apparent at first. All images were public domain and taken from

The game consists of a series of bidding contests in which the winner of each contest receives a card. Cards that are won will later be used in future bids for new cards. Most contests are won by playing a card with high Excitement, Joy, or Happiness. Each card will have numbered values for each of Excitement, Joy, or Happiness.

Online play will be available shortly on Vassal.

Name: Irondale: Mill of Fortune
Description:
This small bonus expansion for Irondale was distributed with some of the early preorders. It adds a single new building, the Mill of Fortune. (3 are included, one for each deck)

When the Mill of Fortune is built, the player names a building type and draws one card from each deck. Each drawn card that matches the named type is taken into the player's hand, the others are discarded.
Families: Series: Pure Card Line (Small Box Games)

Name: Balneator
Description:
Players are bath attendants in ancient Rome that are vying for the title Balneator. Whoever wins will rule the baths of the Roman Empire and earn riches. In this decisive duel, the players must adjust the baths in the municipal therme to the correct temperature before their opponent does.

Also required to play:
6 dice, 3 each in 2 colours
7 tokens, as awards for correctly heating a bath
2 pawns, one red and one blue

Players take turns to perform both of the following actions in this order:

1. a) Move a Therminator (red or blue pawn) OR b) change the value of one of your dice

2. Move one of your dice

1. a) Move a Therminator in one direction vertically, horizonatally or diagonally as far as you want to an empty space. If it moves directly over a die or ends its move next to one, the value of that die is changed by +1 for the red and -1 for the blue Therminator. However, dice in the central bath are never affected.

1. b) Increase the value of one of your dice up or down by 1.

2. Move one of your own dice vertically or horizontally exactly the number of squares as the value of the die. You may change direction while moving, but may not step on the same space twice during your turn. You may only move over empty spaces. If any entered space is adjecent to a Therminator, adjust the value of the die as above after completing the move.
If you can reach a die of your opponent exactly with your move, you may displace it. You choose the new location, your opponent chooses the new value.
If your die shares the value with a bath and can move there in that exact number of spaces, you may end your move there and you receive the corresponding token.

The first player to collect 4 of the 7 tokens wins.

Name: Zed Run!: The Survival Horror Game Show
Description:
Survival horror game show set 25 years after the zed virus turned 90% of the worlds populaion into flesh eating zombies.

Players must explore a 7 x 7 grid of tiles laid out to create the play area, the Dead City.  During this exploration, gathering items, weapons, and prizes is key, as your contestant is initially tossed unarmed into the fray.  In combat, rolling a 6 on a D6 will score you a kill, and found weapons and items will better that chance.  Hazard tiles will make the run a bit more "hazardous" -- such as adding scores of hungry dead, which you can plop down on your favorite rivals, or "Infection" which will change your recently deceased contestant, into a ZED, now bent on devouring your former rivals and able to control the actions for your lesser zombie brothers.

In Zed Run! you grab the loot, find the exit and win big... the rest is zombie chow!

Components
1 Start tile
48 ZR tiles
32 Zombie Tokens
15 Item Cards
10 Prize Cards
2 dice (six-sided)
4 Character / Zed Cards
4 Character Tokens

Name: Ti Rakau
Description:
This Maori Stick Game is called 'Ti Rakau' in Maori.

This game is played with two people or, at a more advanced level, four people. Each player needs one pair of wooden sticks. Players kneel on the floor across from each other and hold their sticks straight up, ends touching the floor. In unison, they perform a series of movements with their sticks, tapping their sticks together or against their partner's, progressing to throwing a stick to their partner and catching the one being thrown to them.

The aim is to keep going for as long as possible without dropping your sticks.

The last person who hasn't dropped a stick is the winner!

Name: ShuffleBowl
Description:
Players alternate turns rolling pucks, bouncing them off two rubber bands and trying to land in a scoring area similar to curling or shuffleboard.  The object of the game is to score exactly 21 points.  (User summary from rule sheet)

The board is similar to the one used in Rebound but has two shooting lanes with players at opposite ends of the board.

Name: Kugelhund
Description:
Bella and Bello are completely over the moon! Their friend Isabella has come to visit unexpectedly. And of course they want to give her their best bones. But where on earth have they buried them? Oh yes, under the garden gnome and there, beside the watering can. 
Bella and Bello run about tirelessly, burrowing here and digging there...
The one who guides them over the lawn skilfully and is first to dig up the bone for Isabella together with them wins the game.

This game is played with two "dogs", wooden balls with ears attached to them, which are placed in a box which has several holes in the bottom. Each hole is marked by an item: watering can, a garden gnome, etc.

In the standard version of the game, a pile of cards each displaying two items is placed in the middle of the table. The active player takes the box and tries to roll the two dogs in the holes with marked with the items on the top card. If he succeeds, he gets to keep the card. In the meantime, his neighbour is repeatedly rolling a die which has a dog on one side. If he rolls the dog, then the active player's turn is over. The first player to gather three cards wins the game.

In the no-dice version all cards are arranged next to each other on the board. On each card, a burrowing chip is placed, face down. Some of these chips show a bone, others do not. When it is a player's turn, the tries to move the dogs into two holes, and then gets to inspect the burrowing chip on the card corresponding to the holes that the dogs have gone in. If the chip shows a bone, he gets to keep it, otherwise it is returned to the card. When there are only eight chips left on the card, the game ends, and the player with the most bones wins the game.

Name: Conheça o Brasil Estado a Estado
Description:
Card game about brazilian states and its capitals.

The goal of the game is to get more state cards than the other players.

There are three types of cards: brazilian maps, brazilian states and clues. Each player receive three state cards. One clue card is  showed and the first player to call a state that corresponds to the clue, wins the state card. The game finishes when all clue cards are turned.

Name: 戦闘メカ・ザブングル
Description:
This game represent land-ship voyage in the science fiction animate cartoon series 'Xabungle'.
This game was designed for the beginner.

Each player goes to the destination by his land-ship. It gets the blue-stones during the voyage by the battle and the trade. Also get the blue-stones by arriving at the destination early. The player who got most minerals does a victory.

A rule is divided into two steps of the basic game and the advanced game, and it uses a different game board.

A basic game proceeds through the straight road decided by a course, and does a battle in accordance with the indication of map.

A hex map with the geographical features is used with an advanced game. It can trade and refueling by the specific terrain. It becomes a battle when it approaches the ship of other players.

A battle is resolved by the card play in both rules.
There are the Walker machine cards, a pilot card and a weapon card in the card. A six side die is used with the total strength of each cards and the combat result table, and a battle is resolved.

Name: Elves & Shelves
Description:
Elves & Shelves is a free, print-and-play auction game for 2 to 4 players. Thematically it follows on from Warehouse Elves, with which it shares some components.

The toys have been brought in from the warehouse and placed on the sorting shelves. Your job as the sorting elves is to collect them according to the children’s Wishlists.

The game is played over 3 rounds of single-card blind bidding (tied bids cancel out). At the end of each round, scoring takes place. The player with the highest score after the third round is the winner.

Winner of the 2010 Christmas Print and Play Game Design Contest

Name: Chinzei Gunki
Description:
This is expansion kit for ä¹å·žä¸‰å›½å¿— (Kyushu Sangokushi).
It covers battles for the conquest of Kyushu by Toyotomi Hideyoshi.

Four scenarios are included in this kit:

    "Battle of Hetusigi-gawa" (1 turn)
    "Siege of Iwaya castle" (short)
    "Battles between Satsuma and Bungo" (short)
    "Kanpaku goes west" (short but with a very large army coming from central Japan)



NB: "Chinzei Gunki" means "Record of the fight for Kyushu".
 A "gunki" is a war story (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gunki_monogatari); Chinzei was an older name for Kyushu (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyushu).

Name: New Characters (fan expansion for Revolution)
Description:
In this variant of Revolution, the player with the most meeples can, in a particular area, use the special ability of the character who is presently there.

Expanded by

    6 character pieces
    5 markers


Published in Spielbox #5/2010

Name: Backblast #1
Description:
A magazine devoted to the game of Advanced Squad Leader. Included were articles about tactics of the game as well as nine scenarios.

Taming Tulagi features US Marines digging the Japanese out of their caves on Tulagi island in 1942.

Throwing Down the Gauntlet pits a Canadian paratroop company against dug in Germans on D-Day.

Point of the Sword depicts British advanced elements assaulting the Germans in a fortified town on D-Day.

A Desperate Affair has the lightly armed German paratroopers dropping directly on top of British forces on the island of Crete.

Going to Church has been reprinted twice since this magazine was released and has been played more than any other scenario in this product. SS troops have to hold a church against advancing Canadian infantry.

Shattering the Line shows the twilight years of the Third Reich as hopelessly outnumbered German infantry try to stop the Soviet advance outside of Berlin.

The Pinnacle is another cave busting scenario on the island of Ie Shima in 1945. US Army regulars with heavy armored support try to dislodge a well dug in Japanese battalion.

Castello Fatato has the surrounded Italians attacking a small Russian village during the Stalingrad campaign as the Italians attempt to reach friendly lines.

A Wedge in the Ice depicts the Finnish defense of the Mannerheim Line late in the Winter War against a vastly superior Russian assault force.

Name: Sanada Gunki
Description:
This game is operational level wargame for siege of Osakaï¼Ž
Each player control either Osaka side (aka Toyotomi Army) or Kanto side (aka Tokugawa Army).
NB: A "gunki" is a war story or record (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gunki_monogatari).
"Sanada Gunki" can be translated by "Record of Sanada Yukimura (most famous commander in this campaign) and his troop".

Each troop organized by one or more unit.
The game repeats the game turn decided by the scenario. Each game turn divided for two player turn. Each player turn include Movement phase, none active side reaction movement phase, Force march phase and combat phase. All unit can move in movement phase, but required pass activity check in reaction and force march phase. Combat result by fire power CRT and two dice.

Victor of the games is decide by victory points. The victory point is provided by the capture of the castle, the removal of the enemy units and unit in the enter important city or province.

The game contain Winter campaign scenario and Summer campaign scenario with three fictional variant.

GAME SCALE : Each hex of map is roughly 5000 meters. Each game turn represents three days of real time. Each combat units represents about 2500 soldiers.

Name: Die ägyptische Pyramide
Description:
Players try to form the longest possible continuous rows of balls. Winner is the one scoring most points.

In his turn player places one ball of his color on a 6x6 grid (36 recessed spaces on the board). The other players place their balls, turn by turn. The aim is to form continuous rows of one color, running horizontally, vertically or diagonally, until the first layer of the pyramid is complete. Once a floor is finished, the players count their points. Each layer is scored separately. Each alignment scores the number of balls that it has. Some balls scores several times if they are at the crossroads of several alignments.

On each floor, the plateau decreases a little more.

When the pyramid is completed, the players count the lines that appear on the slopes of the pyramid.

For two players, there are two options: Either everyone plays two colors, or players build a smaller pyramid.

Name: Outlaws: Adventures in the Old West
Description:
'The year is 1876. The small town of Deadrock is almost deserted; anyone with any sense had already left town. Only Sheriff Jim Murray and his deputies Samuel and Dale remain. Incarcerated in the town's jail is one of the Carson Gang, Luke Young.

Jim watches as a cloud of dust approaches from the west. He knows it is the Carson Gang coming to get Luke. He picks up his trusty Winchester '73, barks a few instructions to Samuel and Dale, wearily walks to the window of his office and waits.....'

Will Jim and his deputies see off the gang long enough for Marshall Samson and his men to arrive? Or will Jesse spring Luke in time and make their escape? Both men's fates are in your hands...

Outlaws is a free Print & Play fast playing game of gunfights, bank heists and general shenanigans set in the Old West of America. Each character in the game has his own character card with which a player tracks what he holds and carries and any wounds he picks up.

The game can be played in two modes: stand alone scenarios called shootouts, and adventures where several scenarios are linked together into a larger storyline.

The game system is based around an action track system where characters expend actions to perform activities. Wounds are represented by randomly drawn wound counters that may result in anything from a small leg graze to a belly wound that will get worse during the course of the game to a direct head shot that takes out a man immediately.

The initial release of the game is titled; Outlaws: Adventures in the Old West - Episode One. Each episode will  include the base rules which run to 12 pages and include many illustrations on all aspects of play. There is also a Shootout and Adventure booklet containing scenarios.

In Episode One there are 10 maps - each will print on a single US Letter or A4 page and will tile with each other to create a large range of environments in which scenarios are set. Episode one contains all you need to play.

Name: Captures
Description:
In Captures, each player has three leopards (the targets) and a cube (the hunter) with one side open. Your goal is to capture as many of your opponent's leopards as possible while being the last player to have at least one leopard in the wild.

On your turn, you move your hunter cube to try to catch an opponent's leopard. You catch a leopard when your hunter is on the path of an opponent's cube and the leopard is in its open side.

In the end, players tally their points — 1 point for each captured leopard and 6 points for each leopard still free — and the player with the highest sum wins.

Name: En Pointe Toujours!: Combats pour Huguette 6
Description:
A tactical expansion to En Pointe Toujours !, game system originally published (in French) in Vae Victis magazine issue 16.

This game, is a campaign during the long siege of Dien Bien Phu, during 5 nights, 1st to 6th April 1954.

Fighting for the ancient "Anne-Marie 3", north to the vital runway, the French forces (I/2REI, III/13 DBLE and II/1 RCP) French Foreign Legion and Paratroopers, must hold the strongpoint, Huguette 6, night after night, against the Viet-Minh forces humans waves and artillery support.

New counters and rules.
A4 map.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: En Pointe Toujours! system (Vae Victis)

Name: Daddy Long Legs
Description: Flick the colored spinner and pivot either leg of your Daddy Long Legs to the appropriate color. You may be able to move forward but you might have to move backwards! First player to reach the finish line wins!

Name: BattleTech: Record Sheets – 3025 & 3026
Description: From the back of the book: BattleTech Record Sheets 3025 & 3026 provides more than 200 filled-out record sheets for the Battlemechs, tanks, hovercraft, and VTOL's described in Battletech Technical Readouts 3025 and 3026, including major variants and alternate configurations. As an added feature, the game information for weapons and equipment appears on each sheet for easy reference.

Name: The Gary's Game
Description:
From the rules

Welcome to the world of Gary's Games and Hobbies -- in a card game!

Ever wondered what kind of people hang out at a game store and play games? Have you ever thought about what that might be like?

Well wonder no more! The Gary's Game will let you experience the excitement and drama from your own home with your own friends.

User Summary

Climbing game, similar to The Great Dalmuti or Pyramid Card or Scum: The Food Chain Game or Deathtrap Dungeon: Card Game or Dilbert: Corporate Shuffle or ... Players try to get rid of their cards as fast as possible. The first person to get rid of their cards becomes Head of the Line in the next hand. Differences include two wild cards, which can be paired with any card, or if both in one hand, can used before the game begins to reorder the table completely.

The card themes are based on the staff and customers of Gary's Games and Hobbies in Seattle, WA. The game was released to celebrate the store's twentieth anniversary in October of 2010.

Name: Neutral Zone:  A Game of Interstellar Expansion
Description:
From the Designer....
Neutral Zone is a game of interstellar expansion that can be played by 2 to 6 people. The setting of the game is a spherical volume of space and the 61 stars, including Sol, that occupy this volume. In the game of Neutral Zone, six galactic powers compete for control of this area of space, and seek to dominate all of the stars within it.
Neutral Zone is a game where 6 alien empires trade, fight, and negotiate over resources and real-estate. Six sets of plastic playing pieces representing Space and Planetary [Ground] Forces are used. Planets are randomly drawn and placed on each star. The planets determine what resources and events occur to all players.

Name: Carolus. Great Northern War
Description:
Designer summary: Carolus. Great Northern War is a Card Driven game focusing on the events of the war between Sweden, led by young king Karl XII and coalition of her enemies: Russia (led by Pyotr, later known as Peter the Great) Saxony (led by Augustus der Starke - the Strong) and Denmark (led by Frederik IVth). The war has also spread to initially neutral Poland, which became a battleground for involved powers.

In history, the Coalition has lost three major battles in the first year of the war. But the war continued, even despite early Danish withdrawal and Saxon surrender, which followed six years later. Carolus, who was also able to put his own king on Polish throne in the meantime, faced his last active enemy - Russia. His failed attempt at taking Moscow became the pivotal event and a milestone in Northern European history.

Players will be able to recreate those events or find their own alternative strategies to win the Great Northern War themselves.

The game is currently in development, first bits will be hopefully shown at Essen Spiel 2010.

Name: Legend of the Dragon's Fortune
Description:
Legend has it that once every hundred years a dragon descends from the sky and bestows a large fortune upon the magician who has the best control of the elements. It has been a hundred years since the last contest and mages from all over the land have gathered in anticipation. In spite of being a young mage you have proven your mettle by outlasting all but six other mages. Suddenly the skies are lit by a blinding light and out of the sky emerges the most magnificent of all creatures. The Dragon has arrived and perched on Mount Fuji, the legend is true! Your resolve has redoubled; the time to make your mark on the world and gain a fantastic fortune is close.

Can you keep your focus and control the elements to win?

Dragon's Fortune is a print and play set collection game. The player who can cast the right spells and score the most points wins. Dragon's Fortune can currently be printed via artscow.

Here are links to the artscow decks. You will need to print both decks to play the game.
Deck 1: Link coming soon!
Deck 2: Link coming soon!

Name: Electronic Sea Battle
Description:
Each player has a fleet of ships which they may position both horizontally and vertically on their own playing grid.  The players then take turns trying to sink their opponent's ships by firing missiles at them.  The player who successfully sinks their opponent's fleet first, wins the game.

The Radio Shack SEA BATTLE game is the modern electronic successor to the well-known Sea Battle game.  Two people can play against each other or one player can play against the computer.  Play the Traditional Game as well as several exciting new variations such as:

Live Action Game with scoring: Quickest to the draw wins the right to fire.

Salvo Game: Each side fires 5 shots in a row.

Advanced Game: Players get to choose their fleet size.

Solo Game: Play against the computer!

Name: Poppin' Puzzlers
Description:
This is basically a two-player version of the 1970's game Perfection, in which you have a set of plastic shapes that fit into holes on the board. The board is pushed down into a spring-loaded box with a timer. When you fit all your shapes into the right holes, you turn off the timer. If you don't turn it off in time, it pops and sends all your pieces flying.

Poppin' Puzzlers is exactly like that except each player has his own set of pieces, orange or yellow, and you play on opposite sides of the game unit. There are 20 pieces for each player. The pieces get stored in a compartment on the top of the game board.

Name: Roll 'n Divide
Description: In Roll 'n Divide, players work together to form division equations and then build individual triangles with double-sided chips (one color on each side for each team) to win the game.  You roll a 10-sided die to determine the quotient (answer) you need to make.  The you pick a chip for the dividend number and divisor number.  You can place them anywhere on the board, either to be part of a triangle you are making or to block your opponent from making a triangle.  If you roll 7 for example, you can take the 56 chip and the 8 chip to place on the board.  You could also take the 77 chip and 11 chip to put on the board. You are able to turn over an opponent's if you are able to use the previously used number in your new equation.  The game board doubles as a storage tray for the pieces.

Name: Pix Mix
Description:
In Pix Mix, players are presented with a jumble of images and they need to determine what's what – and fast.

To set up for the round, each player takes six transparent cards from the bottom of the deck of eighty cards and (without looking at them) inserts them into one of the four card holders in the game. (With two players, each player sets up two card holders.) Ideally these cards have been mixed and shuffled so that they face in different directions. Once all the holders are set, each player passes a holder left, then a 30-second sand timer is started, during which time each player writes down on their score sheet what images they think they see in the line-art jumble. Players go through this process for each holder, then they reveal the images one by one. A player scores one point for each image correctly identified.

After two complete rounds, the player with the highest score wins.

Name: Figure Grand Prix
Description:
It's the world's first figure skating board game! Represent your country in the Figure Grand Prix. Who will be the figure skating queen in this competition? Enjoy all the thrill and excitement of figure skating with this board game!

Players control skaters from 6 different countries.  There are 2 rounds of play - a short program and a long program.  Each skate routine is started by a jump and ends with a spin.  Players draft sets of cards to perform their routine for the most points they can.

Contents:
72 Cards
1 Game Board
5 Player Markers
5 Player Tokens
1 Starter Marker
1 Die
1 Scoring Book(30 Sheets)
1 Rule Book(in Korean, English, German, and Japanese)

Award:
Won a Prize @ 2010 Korea Boardgame Create Competition - organized by KOCCA and MCST

Name: Spin Bingo
Description: This Spin Bingo game is an all-in-one organized version of the classic that keeps things somewhat tidy. An 18-inch octagonal plastic tray cradles eight sets of numbered Bingo cards, while small wells beside each hold plastic chips for covering the numbers on the cards. In the center of the tray, a spinning roulette-style wheel catches a steel ball in a lettered, numbered space when it stops--telling players what numbers to cover in their race to get five in a row. For younger players who are just learning to read double-digit numbers, it's good reinforcement; but, it's also fun for adults who usually can't sit through a "kid's" game.

Name: Discover Through Play with Chicky
Description: This is a roll-and-move game published as an advertising premium for the KFC Chicky Club in Singapore. Players roll two dice and move their Chicky token forward that number of spaces, trying to be the first to reach the Finish (on space 100). Along the way players may land on special spaces and have to follow the instructions on the space - one of these sends the player to their room where they have to roll six before continuing. Landing on a player sends that player back to the start.

Name: Heads and Tails
Description:
This appears to be a reproduction of an older game. From the rules:
"Heads and Tails is the ideal family card game suitable for all ages. The box contains 48 cards which form 24 complete pictures and the cards can be swapped around to make 576 different pictures."

In the game for several players, the cards are dealt out completely to all players and players lay down as many complete pairs as they can make. Subsequently, players play one card to the table at a time, trying to match a head to a tail - in this phase, any head and be matched to any tail.

In the game for one player, the player stacks the heads in one deck and the tails in another and reveals one from each deck simultaneously if they match, the pair is set aside, if not, the next pair is revealed. The player goes through the deck as many times as necessary to pair off all cards.

Name: Pokemon Challenge
Description:
From the box, "The electronic head-to-head spinning top game. Which Pokemon is stronger? With the Pokemon Challenge, the electronic head-to-head spinning top game, you can find out!

Choose two Pokemon characters from the included disks and insert one into each top. Use the electronic turbo-launch system to launch them into the battle arena. Each player has two sets od flippers to keep the action moving. The last top spinning is the winner!"

Name: Monopoly: Schwarzwald
Description:
From manufacturers description:

Monopoly Schwarzwald (black forest) by Winning Moves.
The regional editions of Monopoly. Who doesnt know the fascination of this game. With the regional editions one can play in different regions/cities/towns: the birthplace, the home region or a region where one always wanted to visit.

In my own words:
Monopoly Schwarzwald (black forest) is the adaptation of the famous Monopoly game unto the the black forest region in southern germany. A region with nice scenery and which is a famous tourist destination.

Name: Tchibum na Lagoa
Description:
Tchibum na Lagoa is a game publiched by Brazilian Cosmetic Company Natura to call in children to clean a garbage full pool and restore wild life to it.

It is a cooperative game to children from 4 years old. On each ones turn, the player rolls the dice and move their boats around the pond to collect recyclable trash, put the trash in recycling bins or restore wild live to the pond, which can only be done after the pond is clean. The players have 12 rounds to perform this task. The die rolling have a twist in which a player's results may be divided among two players, if the right side is up.

Name: 九七式中戦車 (Type 97 medium tank)
Description:
"Type 97 medium tank" is 4th game of "Tank Combat series". This game represent tactical tank to tank combat inã€€Pacific theater. This game include 29 Japanese tanks, 10 Russian tanks, 9 US tanks and 10 anti-tank guns.

Each player control one or more tanks and battle for opponent tanks or guns by scenario order.

Each turn divided 6 Impulse. Each impulse repeat movement then fire and overrun. Game proceeds very slowly, but near simultaneous progress with not pre-plotted.

SCALE : Each unit represent one AFV or one anti-tank gun. Each turn represent 30 seconds in real time.

Name: Norenberc: Bonus Townsmen
Description:
Norenberc: Bonus Townsmen is an expansion for Norenberc that was originally available to early adopters at Essen 2010.

It consists of eight additional townsmen, which have a red background to distinguish them from those in the base game. They are shuffled into the starting deck before any townsmen are returned to the box. The bonus townsmen are two "Bankers," two "Jack-of-all-trades," one "Historian," one "Merchant," one "Haggler," and one "Duchess."

Name: Dr. Gardner's PICK-AND-TELL GAMES
Description:
A roll-and-move game with each space indicating one of four grab-bags containing storytelling prompts (small plastic toys, face pictures, words, and descriptive actions), additional movement, or spinner use (resulting in further movement or chip award / loss). When a child lands on a "bag" space, a prompt is drawn, and varying numbers of chips are awarded for the originality and completeness of story the child tells the therapist (a beginning, middle, and end being encouraged).  The therapist may then be awarded chips for a responding story to which the child may respond for more chips.

From the publisher's description found on multiple websites listing this game for sale:

A Psychotherapeutic Game for Children

In this effective and comprehensive therapeutic game, Dr. Richard A. Gardner has combined four therapeutic storytelling techniques: The Bag of Words, The Bag of Toys, The Bag of Acts, and The Bag of Faces, incorporated in all of the important elements that have made Dr. Gardner`s games a staple of childhood therapy.

The instructions detail the effective use of this storytelling technique as a diagnostic and therapeutic tool, with many case examples.

For use by therapist plus one child. 
Ages 5-12

From the directions:

"The time frame of play is not fixed; rather, the duration of play is determined by the therapist's judgement...When the play time is ended, the player with the most chips is declared the winner...The players need not reach the finish point to end the game..."

"The Pick-and-Tell Games are indicated for the wide variety of children's psychotic problems.  They are contraindicated for psychotic children and/or those significantly involved in fantasy.  Such children's problems might be entrenched because the games encourage further fantasizing.  Such children should play reality-oriented games e.g. The Talking, Feeling, and Doing Game."

"The Pick-and-Tell Games were designed to be used only by mental health professionals in their therapeutic work with children.  Accordingly, every reasonable attempt is made to limit the sale and distribution of the game to such professionals."

Name: Snowball Arena
Description:
Snowball Arena has been created during the Christmas Print And Play Game Design Contest 2010.

Snowball Arena is a tactical game, where two teams of up to 4 players each have to get the Christmas gifts into their home base.
Each round players select one card out of six to determine their possible actions this turn.
Combat is dice driven, however it is not the primary goal to get rid of the other players - since they will respawn anyway. The goal is to get the presents into the home base, before the other team gets them.

Name: Oak Island
Description:
Oak Island, Nova Scotia, 1900

In 1795, Daniel McGinnis found a 10-foot circular indentation in the ground, in the centre of a man-made clearing. A large branch (and some say the remains of a pulley) hung directly above the pit. He recruited friends and, armed with shovels, they began to dig. They found a solid floor of oak-logs every 10 feet for a considerable depth. Sea-water floodied the pit and prevented them from digging further. What still lies buried over 100 feet below the surface depends on who you ask: Captain Kidd’s treasure, Incan gold, Shakespeare’s lost manuscripts, the Holy Grail, or perhaps nothing at all.

Over the years more men brought their ingenuity to bear on the problem, but failed. The failures were due to lack of modern machinery and ignorance; each excavation being stopped by water and lack of funds. A new century brings new technology and every hope that the mystery of Oak Island will soon finally be put to rest.

Oak Island is a board game for 3-5 players attempting to get to the bottom of the mysterious treasure pit on Oak Island. The amateur treasure hunters bring their resources to bear on the problem of excavating the pit, and compete with each other to publish their findings and theories using an innovative scoring system.

Players take turns picking up a row or column of resource cards from the card display. Action cards set in the display are triggered when a player picks it up. Machinery cards in the display do not refresh until the next round. A round ends when a player picks up the Treasure Trove License card, triggering an excavation.

The Money Pit consists of consecutive tiles that are revealed as they are excavated jointly by the players. In order to excavate a tile, the symbols shown on it must be matched on resource cards invested secretly and simultaneously by the players. Each resource card has an abstract monetary value ($, $$, or $$$); the players are ranked in order of investment, with the one who invested least playing first in the next round. The player who invested most gets first pick of the assets (clues, machinery, and victory points) collected by the venture.

Another source of VPs are the theories a player can publish. A theory consists of two or more clues joined together. A complete theory is any size rectangle (2xY) while a partial theory is any other assembly of clue pieces. Publishing a theory during the game consists of a player revealing one or more new clue pieces to form a new theory, or revealing one ore more new clue pieces and reinterpreting the clues of the same colour in an existing public theory (theirs or another players) in order to form a new theory. Clues that don’t make it into the new theory cost the player points. The first clue played of any given colour are worth bonus points. Adjacent clues of the same colour within a theory are worth additional points. Complete theories earn a player 2 points per clue, excluding blank ones - incomplete ones earn a player 1 point per clue, including blank ones.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: The Great Floatini
Description:
From the back of the box:

The magic game of floating fun!

Add rabbits to the floating figure to test Floatini's powers to their limit.

From the Introduction:
The Great Floatini is famed throughout the world for his amazing magical powers.  Aided only by his son Teeny Floatini's small balloon, the Great Floatini is able to levitate his wife, Floatina, before your very eyes!

Once this amazing magical feat has been achieved it is your job to test the Great Floatini's powers to their limit by adding rabbit after rabbit to his wife's floating figure.

But be careful -- one rabbit too many and not even The Great Floatini can cope!  The burden of one bunny too many will send the rabbits, Floatina and even Floatini's top hat crashing to the floor.  A disastrous end to a fabulous performance, that will result in the player responsible losing the game.

Name: A Cut Above
Description:
Trivia game from an age when smoking and board games could be related. Unusual large triangular box. Published by a cigarette maker, intending that pub landlords might leave the game in the bar for customers to play. Game equipment:
1 Magnetic Playing Board
A set of 5 playing counters (and 2 spare sets)
896 Question and Answer cards
4 Winner's Medals
1 cord to hang the board on a wall if required
The board looks like a cross between Pictionary and Ludo. It is intended that teams of 4 people play. When your team gets to answer a question, they can choose A Snip (easy), A Cut (medium) or A Cut Above (difficult). The subject they get is determined by the colour of the space they are on. The sujects are:
Purple: General Knowledge
Blue: Sport
Red: TV and Films
Yellow: Music
If you are correct, your marker moves forward either 1, 2 or 3 spaces on your track. The winning team is the first to get to the end of their track. And, Yes, the team get real-life metal medals, each with a ribbon cord.

Name: Desmond Lynam's Sports Trivia
Description:
Trivia game, using a name of a popular TV sport presenter of the time. It was a stand alone game but was primarily aimed at the Trivial Pursuit player who wanted more questions/categories. Each card has 6 questions, each in a different category. A die is provided. The player rolls the die and answers the question allocated to the die roll. If it is answered correctly, two points are scored and the same player can roll for another question.If it is a wrong answer, the player to the left gets a chance and scores one point. The first to 40 points, wins.The 6 categories are;
Names including Nicknames
Numbers
Home Events occuring in UK
Events occuring abroad
Olympic Games
Miscellaneous including Quotations

Name: Additional Trivia
Description:
Trivia game. It is a stand alone game but was primarily aimed at Trivial Pursuit players looking for more questions/categories. Each card has 6 questions, each in a different category. A die is provided. The player rolls the die and answers the question allocated to the die roll. The 6 categories are;
Books
U.K.
Films
Rest & Play
Music
Pot Pourri
The first player to get a correct answer in each of the 6 categories scores a bonus number of points and the game ends. The player with the highest score at that time, wins

Name: Barry Norman's Extra Trivia: T.V. & Movies
Description:
Trivia game, using the name of a famous film review show on British television. It is a stand alone game but was primarily aimed at Trivial Pursuit players looking for more questions/categories. Each card has 6 questions, each in a different category. A die is provided. The player rolls the die and answers the question allocated to the die roll. The 6 categories are;
Oscars
TV
Actors
Names
Actresses
Miscellaneous
The first player to get a correct answer in each of the 6 categories scores a bonus number of points and the game ends. The player with the highest score at that time, wins.

Name: Extra Trivia: General Knowledge
Description:
Trivia game. It is a stand alone game but was primarily aimed at Trivial Pursuit players looking for more questions/categories.Each card has 6 questions, each in a different category. A die is provided. The player rolls the die and answers the question allocated to the die roll. The 6 categories are;
Living World
People & Places
Words & Phrases
Titles & Portrayals
All Our Yesterdays
Miscellaneous
The first player to get a correct answer in each of the 6 categories scores a bonus number of points and the game ends. The player with the highest score at that time, wins

Name: Whoops-a-Daisy
Description: Game inspired by the commercial success of Pass the Pigs. In this case, the 'dice' are two cute little cows. You throw the cows on to a board, around the outside of which is an illustrated picket fence. The fence is divided by fence-posts and you use this as a scoring track. Made to advertise Anchor Butter, a leading brand in Britain.

Name: Low Tanks
Description:
Unauthorized, re-themed Parody of No Thanks!

It is an unofficial multiplayer parody version of the card game No Thanks!, which was created by Thorsten Gimmler.  This parody is not associated with or endorsed by Thorsten Gimmler or any of the publishers.

As in No Thanks!, players are given the choice of taking a card or laying a chip on the card to pass.  The player who takes the card also gets all of the chips that have been placed on it.  At the end of the game, a player's score is the total of all cards taken (or the lowest card in a run of cards), less chips; lowest score is the winner

(Per the instructions included with the game.)

Name: Globe Trotters
Description:
The game compares the everyday life and environment of children from the Arctic, Africa, Europe, South America, and Asia.

Each of five boards depict and number twelve environmental aspects of one of the five continents.  Each player receives a board & eight tiles.  A player asks a specific person for a tile that corresponds to a location on his board.  If the answer is yes, the player takes the tile and places it on his board.  He continues to ask as long as his requests are successful.  The game is over when all the boards are filled, and the winner is the one who first completed their board.

Rules are provided for an easier and a harder game variation.

On the sides of the board, the numbered locations are named in thirteen languages.  The rule book also comes in thirteen languages.

Name: Warhammer: Invasion – Omens of Ruin
Description:
From the publishers website:

Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce the upcoming release of Omens of Ruin, the first Battle Pack in The Morrslieb Cycle for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game! This winter, a strange moon will rise, casting the Old World in a sickly green light. What horrible future can be foretold? And what does this mean for the factions vying for control of the Old World?

Kicking off this exciting series, Omens of Ruin introduces the nimble Wood Elves and their mysterious Forest Spirit allies. Meanwhile, the mighty River Troll joins the fray and Dark Elf Infiltrators invade the ranks of their enemies! With three copies each of twenty never-before-seen cards, Omens of Ruin is designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Warhammer: Invasion metagame.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Warhammer Invasion – Living Card Game

Name: Battle Flag TCG
Description: Solo American civil war card game. Every turn draw cards until you have four cards in your hand, you decide when to play the good and bad ones. But end a turn with four cards and you lose. Primarily you place cards into play, pushing toward the enemy general. Use flanking,charging, artillery with your line formations.  Free print and play, 40 cards in all, plus rules. A quick play game with no bean counting or dice rolling.

Name: Lingua Ludica
Description:
Language learning games with various editions in different languages. Two or more teams are competing, but two individuals can also play. Teams with different language levels can compete, but within a team, the players should have roughly equal abilities,
The players roll and move, then a player from another team draws a card from a category depending on the field the active team landed on and the language level of the active team. Questions or tasks are read out, and the active team has to answer/perform them. If successful, they collect the card and continue, if not, their turn ends.
Categories include definitions (taboo-like), grammar, culture, expressions, vocabulary and role playing. The first team to collect a card from each category is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Three Plains
Description:
Three Plains is a print and play tabletop fantasy wargame, where two or more players compete against each other with "armies" consisting of small figures, which are down loaded and printed off and assembled by the players themselves. All the general rules are described in this eBook and the rules themselves are designed to be used on a tabletop gaming board surface, simulating combat on a battle in a balanced and fair manner. However, games may be played on any appropriate surface, although the standard is a 1 metre by 2 metre tabletop decorated with model scenery in scale with the miniatures. Any individual or group of miniatures in the game is called a "Playing Piece", whether represented by a single model, or group of similar troops.

Three Plains is largely set on the Middle Plain, on the World of 'Many' Names, so called because no race will acknowledge any of the other races titles. Although all have a word for ‘Many’ and over the years Many has become the bilingual name for their World. The World of Many much resembles an ancient earth long past, with warlords running amuck and empires throwing their weight around and there are some great individuals, who are commonly known as Hero’s, Lords and Wizards who face each other on the field of battle usually fighting to the death. This world also has its share of Beasts too, Dragons, Ogres, Wyverns and hundreds more roam and terrorise the lands of Many plaguing the younger races.

Name: Rise and Decline of the Three Kingdoms
Description:
"Rise and Decline of the Three Kingdoms" is a self-published wargame based on the Romance of the Three Kingdoms, a Chinese historical novel.

Players control one Warlord in the end of the Han Dynasty. Many leaders do an important function as well as the story in the game. They appear and leave by the fate card.

Turn order is decided by a chit-pull activation system. Active player chooses an action from recruit, diplomacy and war per province. A Battle is resolved in the method decided every round with dice from Leader Duel, Intrigue and Army Combat.

Victory is determined by controlled province valute and city value at end of the game.

Components (Second edition)

    about 1000 counters (not die-cut)
    225 fate cards
    1 map (A2 size)
    2 reference sheet
    5 organization sheet
    11 random cards
    1 description sheet
    1ã€€rulebook
Families: Theme: Romance of the Three Kingdoms

Name: 上陸作戦 (Landing Operation)
Description:
This is operational level wargame for beginner. The battle modeled on Japanese Amphibious Operation in early stage of Pacific war.

One player control Japanese Invasion troops and other player control Allied Defense troops. 
Rule based on standard wargame rules.
A victory is decide by capture of the capital in the game length limit.

Name: Great Empires
Description:
In Great Empires you choose one of the great civilizations in history and pit your luck and skill against other greats to prove your mettle! Do you rush your enemy with basic infantry, or do you hold out for your elite troops and your commander? Does your god shine his blessing upon you, ensuring your victory, or do suffer crushing defeat?

Players roll dice, scoring Troops, Elites, and Commanders, while avoiding the dreaded Defeat dice, in an attempt to knock their opponents out of the game! The Blessing die adds another level of excitement, giving players a chance to bask in the blessing of their god, granting bonuses!

Get your opponents down to 0 points to win, but make sure to reinforce before you find yourself at 0 points!

Name: Loot Drama
Description:
From the rulebook introduction:

In Loot Drama, you and your friends play the part of online gamers who are eager to get themselves some epic loot (hereafter properly referred to as ‘Lewt’) in tonight’s game session (aka the Raid).

Game play recreates the drama of the bidding and jockeying for position to be the first in line to get the best Lewt.  By spending the DKP (bidding currency) you earned over the night, you work your way forward in the Lewt Line to get the choicest items.  But beware, drama abounds as everyone begins to whine and moan about how they deserve it more, upsetting your priority in the line.

Can you and your friends make it through the night and still be on speaking terms?

Name: Shifters
Description:
From the Rules:

In Shifters, each player is a mystical shape changer competing against the other players in a series of trials to be named the next master shape-shifter.  Trials entail a battle of wits that will require bluffing, deduction, and careful timing to win.  Players earn trial tokens by having animal "morph" cards in play with attributes that best match the requirements of the current trial.  Players will also cast a variety of spell and obstacle cards to hinder their competitors or propel themselves to victory.  But be careful! Cards are selected in a hidden fashion with all players revealing their moves simultaneously.  When shape-shifting is involved, you will need to be cunning to stay ahead.  When all the trials are completed, the player with the most trial tokens wins!

............
Playtesting Request

Shifter's is currently in the second prototype phase, and needs playtesting!  If you would like to playtest Shifters, please send Mezmorki a PM.

Name: Moleko
Description:
See molecules take shape before your eyes!

Each player builds the model of the molecule represented on the molecule card which he has drawn.  The playing pieces are moved around the board from the starting square by die roll, in the direction of the player's choice.  In each case, the action on the space is taken, allowing players to obtain atoms or bonds, discard components, or draw individual or collective event cards.

Has anybody made one of the target molecules?  The first player to finish has the right to compare his molecule with the ones listed on the objective card.  If none of the target molecules has been constructed, he is in a position to create mischief for the other players.

(Paraphrased from the back of the box.)

Name: Agricola: Gamers' Deck
Description:
The Agricola: Gamers' Deck is a medium-sized expansion that includes 59 minor improvement cards and 60 occupation cards. The deck is playable alone but it is best when mixed with EIK.  The cards were developed and tested by users of Play-Agricola (aka Lookout Games' online test group) to fill in gaps in game play that had developed since Agricola first released.

It was designed for use only with the base game. It has enough cards to play with 5 players.

The artwork on the cards is entirely 100% drawn by the original Agricola/Le Havre artist.

Name: På spåret (DVD)
Description: Based on a popular Swedish TV game-show, in a new version including a DVD. The DVD contains questions in the form of film and commentary by TV host Ingvar Oldsberg. The players try to guess the name of a destination based on images from a traveling train or car, while Ingvar gives increasingly more obvious hints. Once a destination is revealed there are more questions about it's local culture or history.

Name: Wars Ancient
Description:
Wars Ancient is a game system created to handle three dimensional wargames with historical miniatures. It is a generic system that can be adapted to different setting. From one version to the other the rules change accordingly to the type of units available, strategies and potential special rules.Wars rules system wants to be quick and enjoyable offering the possibility to run amusing battles where creativity and imagination can easily make up for lack of scenic elements. This edition is set for simulation of ancient period battles.

The game is played on a board of 32' x 40' inch

The goal is to reach 15 victory points, to achieve this we need to eliminate the enemy detachments, or take the enemy camp. The new system is to have the opportunity to create their own armed randomly. This allows to always have a different strategy.

Name: Computer Basketball
Description:
The game consisted of a plastic playing court with two long plastic arms underneath. Players would slide the arms left or right to pick offense or Defense strategy. A light at the intersection of the arms would illuminate a spot on the court giving a code. The code would determine the outcome of the play.

This game was liscensed by the NBA and had actual team logos on the box.

Name: BattleLore: Code of Chivalry
Description:
Code of Chivalry is a human Army Pack for BattleLore that lets you swell the ranks of your armies, and it features knights, arbalestiers, and lancers!

Code of Chivalry comes complete with two new unit types as well as two unit types previously released in the Hundred Years War and the Scottish Wars expansions. These units will easily bolster the forces of any Human army, giving players more options during their BattleLore games.

Also included in this expansion are 6 new Call to Arms Deployment cards so players can customize their adventures. Rather than using the pre-constructed armies found in the adventure book, players can choose to use these Call to Arms Deployment cards to create an army of their own design.

Finally, Code of Chivalry comes with four new adventures to give players a knightly challenge for their new units!

Name: Commands & Colors: Napoleonics Expansion #1 – The Spanish Army
Description:
From GMT Games:

At the time of the Napoleonic Wars, Spain was only a shadow of its former power. Spanish troops and leaders, as many Napoleonic historians point out, performed badly on a large number of occasions. Yet there are a number of battles, Bailen, Tamames, Alcaniz and San Marcial where the Spaniards fought valiantly and gained victory. Ironically, the point most historians overlook is the fact that the Spanish armies constituted a threat that the French simply could not ignore. As good as Wellington’s Anglo-Portuguese field army was, that army faced multiple French armies. They could only defeat one French army at a time. The Spanish Armies and the accompanying guerrilla warfare against French troops tied down the remainder, allowing the Anglo-Portuguese army to ultimately emerge victorious.

In this expansion you will find 18 historical scenarios that focus on Peninsular battles fought by the Spanish army from 1808 to 1813, plus all the new units you’ll need to field for these engagements.=

Name: Panzer: Game Expansion Set, Nr 1 – The Shape of Battle on the Eastern Front 1943-45
Description:
This 1st Panzer expansion set includes detailed TO&Es for the German and Soviet forces covering the entire war period from 1940 through 1945. It also includes a focus on what many consider to be the most intense tank battle in history, Kursk, with OOBs for both forces and TO&Es for four of the most notable German divisions at the moment they saw action during that historic conflict: Grossdeutschland Panzer Grenadier Division and the 1st, 2nd and 3rd SS Panzer Grenadier Divisions. The Soviet Tank and Mechanized Corps are also clearly outlined, as well as the various Infantry and Guard Infantry Divisions and other Support formations.

This first expansion comes with 7 Scenarios. A list can be found below in the Community Wiki section.

The box also includes the first 4 double-sided geomorphic mapboards. With them, players can recreate any number of tactical battles reminiscent of those actions fought out of the seemingly endless steppes of Russia.

In order to play this expansion only the Panzer base game is required. The other expansions are not.

Included Panzer Exp1 units:
German: 15cm sIG, 2.8cm sPzB 41, 2cm FlaK 38, 2cm FlaK Zgkw 1t, 3.7cm FlaK Zgkw 5t, 3.7cm PaK 36, 5cm PaK 38, 7.5cm leIG, 8.8cm PaK 43, Brummbar, Elefant, Grille 33, Hetzer, Jagdpanther, Jagdpanzer IV, Jagdpanzer IV/70, Jagdtiger, Limber, Marder III, Marder III PaK36r, Mobelwagon, Nashorn, Panzerjager I, PSW 221, PSW 221 sPzB, PSW 222, PSW 231, PSW 233, Pz 38(t)E-F, Pz IIF, Pz III(Fl), Pz IIIG, Pz IIIN, Pz IVE, Pz IVF1, Pz IVF2, Pz IVJ, SPW 250/1, SPW 250/10, SPW 250/7, SPW 250/8, SPW 250/9, SPW 251/10, SPW 251/17, SPW 251/2, SPW 251/9, STuG IIIB, STuG IIIF, STuG IV, STuH 42, Wirbelwind
German fliers: Ju 87B-1, Ju 87G-1

Soviet: 100mm M44, 37mm M39, 45mm M37, 45mm M42, 76.2mm M27 IG, 76.2mm M36, 85mm M39, 85mm M44, BA-64B M43, IS-3 M45, ISU-122 M44, ISU-152 M44, KV-1 M42, KV-2 M41, KV-85 M43, M17 MGMC, M2 APC, M3A1 Scout Car, OT-34 M42, SU-122 M43, T-34/76 M41, T-34/76 M42, T-60 M42
Soviet fliers: Pe-2, Su-2

Box contents:

    2 double-sided full-color countersheets with 7/8” counters
    4 double-sided 10" x 27" geomorphic mapboards with 1" hexes (8 maps in total)
    38 double-sided 5” x 4” Unit Data Cards
    German Table of Organization & Equipment booklet
    Soviet Table of Organization & Equipment booklet
    Reference & Scenario Book

Name: Panzer: Game Expansion Set, Nr 2 – The Final Forces on the Eastern Front 1941-44
Description:
This 2nd Panzer expansion set completes the German and Soviet forces with focus on the less common and early war vehicles (Panzer IB, Panzer IVD and Panzer IIIF, BT-7, T-26, early T-34 and KV-1) and Soviet Lend-Lease units (like Sherman III, M3 Lee, Stuart III, Valentine, Matilda and Churchil). The box includes TO&Es for two of the more notable Soviet formations to employ Lend-Lease forces the 18th Tank Corps (July 1943) and the 1st Guards Mechanized Corps (January 1945).

This second expansion comes with 7 Scenarios. A list can be found below in the Community Wiki section.

The box also includes the next 2 double-sided geomorphic mapboards for expanded play and many more battle combinations. Urban warfare is part of the Scenario list with 2 of the mapboards providing ample city terrain for it.

In order to play this expansion only the Panzer base game is required. The other expansions are not.

Included Panzer Exp2 units:
German: 2cm Vierling Zgkw 8t, 3.7cm FlaK Zgkw 8t, Flakpanzer 38(t), Flammpanzer 38(t), Grille 33/1, Ostwind, PSW 234/1, PSW 234/2 Puma, PSW 234/3, PSW 234/4, PSW II Luchs, Pz 38(t) Aufklarer, Pz 38(t)C, Pz IB, Pz IIC, Pz IIIF, Pz IIIJ, Pz IVD, PzKpfw 35(t), SPW 250/11, SPW 251/22; Leg units

Soviet: 12.7mm AAMG, BA-10 M38, BA-20M M36, BT-7 M37, BT-7A M37, BT-8 M38, Churchill III, GAZ-AA, Komsomolyets, KV-1 M40, KV-1 M41, M3 Lee, Matilda II, Sherman III (75), Sherman III (76), Stuart III, SU-57 M43, SU-76i M43, T-26S M37, T-28 M34, 
T-28E M38, T-34/76 M40, T-35 M35, T-38 M37, T-40 M40, T-60 M41, Valentine II, Valentine VIII; Leg units

Box contents:

    2 double-sided full-color countersheets with 7/8” and 5/8” counters
    2 two-sided 10" x 27" geomorphic mapboards with 1" hexes (4 maps in total)
    24 double-sided 5” x 4” Unit Data Cards
    Reference & Scenario Book

Name: Het Letterspel
Description:
In this card-game you lay down your letter-cards to create words like in scrabble. Also, like scrabble you can add your cards to existing cards making words horizontal and vertical. Each card has a value and adding the values of your cards gives your score. As an addition the cards also have, besides the letters and their values, a part of a fish pictured on them. If your cards also forms a correct fish (head, body, maybe more body cards, tail) you score bonus points.

Content: 
80 playing cards with letters and fish-parts.
3 rules cards.
